text: Erginus rubellus is a species of sea snail, a true limpet, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Acmaeidae, one of the families of true limpets. ==Description== ==Distribution== * West Greenland and East Greenland * Canada: Queen Elizabeth Islands, Baffin Island, Labrador, Newfoundland, Nova Scotia * Iceland == Ecology == Habitat of Erginus rubellus include infralittoral and circalittoral of the Gulf and estuary. ==References== This article incorporates CC-BY-3.0 text from the reference. * Gofas, S.; Le Renard, J.; Bouchet, P. (2001). Mollusca, in: Costello, M.J. et al. (Ed.) (2001). European register of marine species: a check-list of the marine species in Europe and a bibliography of guides to their identification. Collection Patrimoines Naturels, 50: pp. 180–213 ==External links== * Category:Acmaeidae Category:Molluscs described in 1780
title: Erginus rubellus
